intro: Whalleya pungens, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Whalleya pungens is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
